subject: Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: Maurice Greene, the former Olympic and world champion in the 100 meters, announced Monday that he was retiring. He cited nagging injuries for his decision. “It’s a little sad for me but it’s happy at the same time because I’ve had a great career,” Greene, 33, said. “For the last couple of years, I’ve had nagging injuries that have stopped my training. So I think it’s better to just call it quits.”Greene was the top sprinter of the late 1990s and early 2000s. He set a then world record for the 100 meters in 1999 (9.79 seconds) and won the 100 at the Sydney Games in 2000. He still holds the indoor 60-meter world record at 6.39 seconds.
